columns.DNO: This column represents the Department Number, indicating which department the student is pursuing a minor in.
columns.StuID: This column represents the Student ID, which uniquely identifies a student in the database.

Minor_in.table_description: The Minor_in table serves to link students to their chosen minors by referencing the relevant department and student identifiers.

columns.StuID: This column represents the unique identifier assigned to each student enrolled in the course.
columns.CID: This column denotes the unique code for the course in which the student is enrolled.
columns.Grade: This column indicates the letter grade received by the student for the enrolled course.

Enrolled_in.table_description: The Enrolled_in table captures the relationships between students, the courses they are enrolled in, and the grades they receive for those courses.

columns.lettergrade: Represents the letter grade assigned to a student, typically used to denote academic performance.
columns.gradepoint: Indicates the numeric value associated with the letter grade, used for calculating GPA and academic standing.

Gradeconversion.table_description: The Gradeconversion table is used to map letter grades to their corresponding grade point values, facilitating the conversion for grading systems within the college.

columns.CID: A unique identifier for each course.
columns.Credits: The number of academic credits awarded for completing the course.
columns.Instructor: The identifier for the instructor teaching the course.
columns.Days: The days of the week when the course is scheduled to occur.
columns.Hours: The time slots during which the course takes place.
columns.DNO: The department number that the course is associated with.

Course.table_description: The Course table contains information about various academic courses, including identifiers, names, credits, instructor assignments, scheduling details, and departmental affiliations.

columns.DNO: This column represents the Department Number, serving as a unique identifier for each department within the college.
columns.FacID: This column signifies the Faculty ID, which uniquely identifies faculty members associated with a department.
columns.Appt_Type: This column indicates the type of appointment the faculty member holds, such as 'Primary' or 'Secondary'.

Member_of.table_description: The Member_of table captures the relationships between faculty members and departments, detailing which faculty are affiliated with which departments and the nature of their appointments.

columns.StuID: This column represents the unique identifier for each student in the college database.
columns.LName: This column contains the last names of the students.
columns.Fname: This column contains the first names of the students.
columns.Age: This column represents the age of each student.
columns.Sex: This column indicates the gender of the students using a single character.
columns.Major: This column represents the major field of study each student is pursuing.
columns.Advisor: This column contains the unique identifier for the student's academic advisor.
columns.city_code: This column represents a code that indicates the city where the student lives.

Student.table_description: The Student table contains essential information about students enrolled at the college, including their personal details, academic major, and advisor information.

columns.FacID: A unique identifier assigned to each faculty member.
columns.Lname: The last name of the faculty member.
columns.Fname: The first name of the faculty member.
columns.Rank: The academic rank or title held by the faculty member, such as Professor or Associate Professor.
columns.Sex: The gender of the faculty member, indicated by a single character (M for Male, F for Female).
columns.Phone: The internal phone extension number for the faculty member.
columns.Room: The office room number assigned to the faculty member within the building.
columns.Building: The name of the building where the faculty member's office is located.

Faculty.table_description: The Faculty table contains information about faculty members, including their identifying details, academic ranks, contact information, and office locations within the college.

columns.DNO: A unique identifier for each department, serving as the primary key.
columns.Division: The division to which the department belongs, typically represented by a two-letter code.
columns.DName: The full name of the department, indicating its academic focus or discipline.
columns.Room: The room number assigned to the department for office or administrative purposes.
columns.Building: The name of the building where the department's office is located.
columns.DPhone: The telephone number assigned to the department for contact purposes.

Department.table_description: The Department table stores information about various academic departments within the college, including their unique identifiers, divisions, names, office locations, and contact details.
